meanings.definition: A shape produced by a curve that bends around and crosses itself.
meanings.sent1: The roller coaster had many exciting loops for riders to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: She tied the ribbon in a loop to decorate the gift.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the loop of yarn, thinking it was a fun toy.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were stuck in a loop, repeating the same worries over and over.
meanings.sent5: The loop of the necklace symbolized their eternal bond.

meanings.definition: A length of thread, rope, or similar material, doubled or crossing itself, typically used for fastening or securing something.
meanings.sent1: He used a loop of rope to secure the tent to the ground.
meanings.sent2: The tailor created a loop with the thread to attach the button.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel got tangled in the loop of the jump rope during playtime.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was held back with a loop of ribbon, like a princess.
meanings.sent5: The loop of wire was perfect for hanging the picture frame.

meanings.definition: A structure, series, or process, the end of which is connected to the beginning.
meanings.sent1: The loop of the roller coaster circled back to the starting point.
meanings.sent2: The loop of the conversation always led back to the same topic.
meanings.sent3: The loop of the movie plot had everyone guessing until the end.
meanings.sent4: Her daily routine felt like a loop, repeating the same tasks each day.
meanings.sent5: The loop of the song's melody was catchy and easy to remember.
